definition: to shut out/to block/to smother
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: If your website was fallen to counterpoised to perhaps be banned by Baidu, how should you do?
sentences.chinese: 假如你的网站被百度降权了或者封杀了，你该怎么办？

sentences.english: As Man Wenjun still acts as image ambassador, should he be blocked or saved?
sentences.chinese: 满文军仍任形象大使，该封杀还是救赎？

sentences.english: Did you know which famous star that was forced out by Songmeiling in those years?
sentences.chinese: 知道谁是当年被宋美龄封杀的好莱坞中国女星吗？

sentences.english: So what did this censorship amount to?
sentences.chinese: 那么，这种审查封杀了什么呢？

definition: to take down from the shelves (e.g. a contaminated product)
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bombard/to bomb/trad. also written 炮轟
to attack (verbally or in writing)
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to support/to back
to resist/to boycott/to refuse (to cooperate)/to reject/resistance/refusal
to suppress/to beat down
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
public opinion
to denounce/to condemn

State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television (SAPPRFT), est. 2013 (abbr. for 國家新聞出版廣電總局|国家新闻出版广电总局[Guo2 jia1 Xin1 wen2 Chu1 ban3 Guang3 dian4 Zong3 ju2])/(prior to 2013) State Administration of Radio, Film, and Television (SARFT)
to start a rumor
to terminate an agreement/to cancel a contract
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to hype/to promote (in the media)
to express pessimistic views about (sth)
